quote: Comprehensive results show that the proposed method outperforms the original U-Net method and other state-of-the-art methods.

U-Net has shown promising results on the neuronal structures segmentation in electron microscopic recordings and cell segmentation in light microscopic images.

Motivated by the Inception-ResNet-V2 block and atrous convolution, we propose dense atrous convolution (DAC) block to encode the high-level semantic feature maps.
By combining the atrous convolution of different atrous rates, the DAC block is able to extract features for objects with various sizes.
The skip connection takes some detailed information from the encoder to the decoder to remedy the information loss due to consecutive pooling and striding convolutional operations.
The cross entropy loss is not optimal for such tasks.

In this paper, we propose an end-to-end deep learning framework named CE-Net for medical image segmentation.
